Guide price

£610,000

(£364/sq. ft)

4 bed detached house for sale Perrys Lane, Seend Cleeve, Seend, Melksham SN12

4 beds
2 baths
2 receptions
1,674 sq. ft

Property location

  • Seend Church of England VA Primary School0.5 miles
  • Bowerhill Primary School1.2 miles
  • Melksham2.9 miles
  • Trowbridge5.4 miles

Features and description

  • 4 Double Bedrooms
  • Beautiful Extensions
  • Fabulous Open Views To Rear
  • Generous Gardens c 0.2 Acre
  • Quality Refitted Kitchen in 2020
  • Sitting Room With Atrium
  • Refitted En Suite & Bathroom
  • Parking For 2-3 Vehicles
  • Great Village Location
  • Canal Side Walks On The Doorstep
**4 double bedrooms** stunning sitting room with atrium & bi-fold doors** incredible views** quality new kitchen**

An utterly charming and beautifully extended detached period cottage, set up a quiet country lane and enjoying a generous garden with a splendid open outlook over rolling countryside. Finished to a high standard throughout and packed with character features, 'Brigadoon' is a beautiful family home. Approached through a handsome oak framed porch, a solid oak door opens into a hallway with travertine limestone flooring from 'Artisans, ' wooden panelled latched doors then lead into a cosy family room with exposed ceiling beams with a stone mullioned window and an Inglenook fireplace with an inviting log burner. Refitted in 2020, the stylish 'Wren' kitchen boasts quartz worktops and an oil fired 'Alpha' cooker (which also provides heating/hot water). There is a central island, a quartz breakfast bar, integrated dish washer, a useful larder cupboard, and French doors by 'Origin' opening onto the garden. A notable feature is the exceptional sitting room which has been extended to incorporate a lantern skylight and bi folding doors with views over the garden and fields beyond. The first floor landing has exposed wooden floorboards and stairs up to the second floor. There are three characterful double bedrooms complemented by a good sized modern bathroom with painted wooden floorboards, cracking views and a bath with a cradle shower. The impressive dual aspect top floor main bedroom has extensive views and oak flooring. The en suite shower room has travertine tiling and a continuation of the oak flooring. Outside, 5 bar gates open onto a gravelled driveway with parking for 2-3 cars and a raised planted border. Side access leads around to a store room with light and power, a WC and utility area. There is box hedging, a raised patio sun terrace, numerous apple trees and a pear tree. A large lawn runs down to a further circular patio with wonderful views beyond

Situation

'Brigadoon' enjoys superb open countryside views to the rear and is located along a quiet country lane with the canal just a stone's throw away from the bottom on the lane. Seend Cleeve and the neighbouring village of Seend enjoy a thriving community and between them have a variety of village amenities including a Post office/general store, two public houses, a village hall, playing field and church. There is an excellent primary school in Seend with secondary schools in Devizes, Trowbridge and Melksham. The historic market town of Devizes has many amenities including town centre shopping, a leisure centre, schools for all ages, various supermarkets, a variety of shops, cinema, theatre and thriving weekly market. The historic Kennet & Avon Canal runs through the town providing fishing and walking facilities. The major centres of Bath, Salisbury, Swindon, Marlborough and Chippenham are all within a 30 mile radius.

Property Information

Tenure: Freehold
Council Tax: Band E
EPC Rating: EER- D / EIR- E
Services: Mains water, drainage and electricity. Oil fired central heating.

1 floor plan available

View the floor plan to understand the space and layout of this property.
